payment

Class DateOperations

  • java.lang.Object
    • payment.DateOperations

  • public class DateOperations
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple method to calculate the difference between dates.
    Author:
    Aaron Cheng
    Invariant:
    SECONDS_IN_DAY = 3600 * 24
    SECONDS_IN_HOUR = 3600

    • Method Detail

      • getDayDifference

        public static int getDayDifference(java.sql.Date first,
                   java.sql.Date second)
        Calculate the difference between the dates between the given dates. Does not take into account the number of weeks that have passed, i.e., calling getDayDifference() and getWeekDifference() will result in the same time period being calculated. I.e. if getWeekDifference() returns 3 (meaning three weeks have passed), getDayDifference() will return 21 (meaning 21 days have passed). Both refer to the same rental, so only one rate needs to be taken into account.
        Parameters:
        first - The first date
        second - The second date
        Returns:
        The number of days which have passed between the first and second dates.
        Pre:
        first < second

      • getWeekDifference

        public static int getWeekDifference(java.sql.Date first,
                    java.sql.Date second)
        Calculate the weeks that are different between the two given dates.
        Parameters:
        first -
        second -
        Returns:
        The number of weeks which have passed between the first and second dates
        Pre:
        first < second

      • getHourDifference

        public static int getHourDifference(java.sql.Date first,
                    java.sql.Date second)
        Calculate the hours that are different between the two given dates. Takes into account the number of days that have passed, and will only return a number between 0-23.
        Parameters:
        first - The first date
        second - The second date
        Returns:
        The hours that are different between the first and second dates.
        Pre:
        first < second
